Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Simplify schema attributes and consolidate definitions" (#496) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
This creates a readonly struct that abstracts the attribute definitions
and management to help with readability and cleaner code.

Before:

```
BenchmarkDotNet=v0.10.14, OS=Windows 10.0.14393.2155 (1607/AnniversaryUpdate/Redstone1), VM=Hyper-V
Intel Xeon CPU E5-2673 v4 2.30GHz, 1 CPU, 2 logical and 2 physical cores
  [Host] : .NET Framework 4.7.1 (CLR 4.0.30319.42000), 64bit RyuJIT-v4.7.2558.0
  net46  : .NET Framework 4.7.1 (CLR 4.0.30319.42000), 64bit RyuJIT-v4.7.2558.0

Job=net46  Runtime=Clr  

|      Method|      Mean|     Error|    StdDev|      Gen 0|     Gen 1|     Gen 2|  Allocated
|  Validation|  79.86 ms|  1.519 ms|  1.560 ms|  2437.5000|  687.5000|  312.5000|   13.86 MB
```

After:

```
BenchmarkDotNet=v0.10.14, OS=Windows 10.0.14393.2155 (1607/AnniversaryUpdate/Redstone1), VM=Hyper-V
Intel Xeon CPU E5-2673 v4 2.30GHz, 1 CPU, 2 logical and 2 physical cores
  [Host] : .NET Framework 4.7.1 (CLR 4.0.30319.42000), 64bit RyuJIT-v4.7.2558.0
  net46  : .NET Framework 4.7.1 (CLR 4.0.30319.42000), 64bit RyuJIT-v4.7.2558.0

Job=net46  Runtime=Clr  

|      Method|      Mean|     Error|    StdDev|      Gen 0|     Gen 1|     Gen 2|  Allocated
|  Validation|  80.01 ms|  1.535 ms|  1.198 ms|  2500.0000|  687.5000|  187.5000|   13.91 MB
```

There is a large reduction of Gen2 allocations, while everything else remains similar. This change reduces the code to handle attributes from 60k LOC to 30k, reduces 3 virtual methods to a single one per schema, and reduces the static arrays per schema from 2 to 1.  A future request will attempt to bring a similar system to the element definitions/creation.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ".NET Core and OpenXmlSDK" (#521) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Description**

Error: Package 'DocumentFormat.OpenXmlSDK 2.0.0' was restored using '.NETFramework,Version=v4.6.1' instead of the project target framework '.NETCoreApp,Version=v2.1'. This package may not be fully compatible with your project.


Is there any plan to support .NET Core or is there a matrix of the version of OpenXmlSDK's supported versions of .NET?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Using the Open XML SDK to manipulate Wrod how do I move the cursor to a particular paragraph" (#520) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
Please help me, when using the Open XML SDK to generate a Word document through the Word template in the.net core platform, how do I move the cursor to a specific paragraph?

中文：在.net core 平台下使用Open XML SDK 通过Word模板生成Word文档时，如何将光标移动到特定的段落？

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "It's appreciate if OpenXML SDK provides calculation mechanism" (#519) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
OpenXML SDK has no calculation mechanism, it makes simple task very complex. For example, a excel file has a formula cell A3=sum(A1:A2), if we need insert a row of data after row1, the formula should change to sum(A1:A3) . 
This can be done automatically either in excel application or in office automation solution. But with OpenXML SDK, we need to do by programming, it's not a simple task because we need parse all the formula elements completely and compose it again.
This is just a simple example about the topic, actually there are many scenarios like this.  It's very appreciate if OpenXML SDK provides calculation mechanism.
